content:
I have instances of MessageDefinition and GraphDefinition that the ig-pub generated narrative shows locally but not in the autobuild.

see : http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-alerts/branches/master/MessageDefinition-admit-1.html
and : http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-alerts/branches/master/GraphDefinition-admit-1.html

it looks like the latest ig-pub update is the culprit - just updated and now is missing locally as well.... also is there a way to turn off the "usage stats to server.".. its slowing me down since I moved to a new place with lower bandwidth ?
I'm curious why sending usage stats is so heavy/slow. (Because I've noticed it consumes a fair bit of time for my system too.)
My local version (a week old) gets an http timeout when sending usage stats, is the stats service running?
server is sick
in fact, the vm is not even running....
should be good now

And a reminder that here's where all that work goes to: http://clinfhir.com/igAnalysis.html (It takes a few seconds to load). I should look at some pretty graphs, now that there's a significant amount of data. Any suggestions?
@Eric Haas I don't see any reason why the narrative would not draw now - is this still a problem?
yes I just tried using the MessageDefinition example from the core spec in my test Ig and there in nothing in the html.xhtml file
do you get any errors in the log?
the narrative is generated and added to the xml and json, and there are no QA errors. I'll check the output logs
yes the errors would be in the output logs
I don't see any errors in the output logs either
sigh. I'll get to it
fixed next release
@Grahame Grieve I was building my IG today and got a timeout on sending usage stats? I thought it had been fixed? Is that not the case?
I'll investigate
ok fixed
hey @David Hay http://clinfhir.com/igAnalysis.html - can we have the view by resource page sorted by path then extension url?
pasted image
sure - will ping when done (likely tomorrow)...
How's that?
love it, thanks
very nice!
can you pull the IHE ones? I know they are not as nice as HL7 but they are published on the IG registry.
it's you who needs to get the IHE guides publishing through the IG publisher, and then they'll get into this system automatically
I was afraid of that... but figured that most of the IHE IGs do have conformance resources now.... that are published on the IHE GitHub. https://github.com/IHE/fhir
as long as you build through the IGPublisher...
soon... real soon... we should put bets on if this is before JIRA at hl7?
